question: Which among the following statements is correct about Fault scarp?
option1: It is a depressed block of planetary crust bordered by parallel faults
option2: It is a raised fault block bounded by normal faults
option3: It is linear lowland created by a tectonic rift or fault
option4: It is an offset on the ground surface where one side of a fault has moved vertically with respect to the other
answer: It is an offset on the ground surface where one side of a fault has moved vertically with respect to the other
explanation: Fault scarp is an offset on the ground surface where one side of a fault has moved vertically with respect to the other. It is a topographic feature associated with tectonic landforms.
